about-content: Inspired by the great Arriving in Berlin map, Refugees Welcome to Norway wanted to create a similar map over Oslo.
about-contributing-code:
Contributing

Content and translations

Suggestions for the map or can help with translations, please contact us on map@rwtn.no.

Code

If you want to contribute with code, the project is available on GitHub.
arrival-pu:
Politiets utlendingsenhet (PU)

This where you have to register when you first arrive in Oslo.

Address: Økernveien 11-13

PUs website
emergency-room-storgata:
Legevakt Storgata 40

Emergency room in the city center.

Open 24 hours.

Adress: Storgata 40

Website.
emergency-room-aker:
Legevakt Aker

Emergency room.

Open 16:00-01:30 monday through friday. Weekends: 10:00-01:30.

Address: Trondheimsveien 235

Website.
library-bjerke:
Deichmanske bibliotek - Bjerke

Holds a weekly language café where you can practice Norwegian together. See website for further information.

Address: Trondheimsveien 275

Website
library-gamle-oslo:
Deichmanske bibliotek - Gamle Oslo

Holds a weekly language café where you can practice Norwegian together. Also holds children fairy tale events in Arabic/Norwegian and Somali/Norwegian. See website for further information.

Address: Hagegt. 28

Website

library-main:
Deichmanske bibliotek - Hovedbiblioteket

Main library in the city center.

Has books in many languages! Holds a weekly language café where you can practice Norwegian together. See website for further information.

Address: Holmlia sentervei 16

Website

legal-jussbuss:
Jussbuss

Free legal help from law students.

New cases must be submitted by phone or in person during the following hours:

  • Monday: 10:00 - 15:00
  • Thursday: 17:00 - 20:00

Phone: 22 84 29 00

Address: Arbinsgate 7

Website
